lead_paragraph: While invoking Hiroshima has become a universal shorthand for the horrors of nuclear war, Nagasaki, where about 74,000 people were killed, has mostly lived in the other city’s shadow.

headline.print_headline: In Shadow of Hiroshima, a City Stands as an Afterthought
headline.main: What About Us, Nagasaki Asks, as Obama’s Hiroshima Trip Nears

snippet: While invoking Hiroshima has become a universal shorthand for the horrors of nuclear war, Nagasaki, where about 74,000 people were killed, has mostly lived in the other city’s shadow.
abstract: Nagasaki Journal; horrors experienced in Nagasaki, Japan, following 1945 nuclear bombing have long existed in shadow of those suffered in Hiroshima; while Nagasaki was second city to be bombed and considered by some to be second in importance, many historians argue repeat attack was greater moral tragedy; Pres Obama's historic visit will include trip to Hiroshima, but not Nagasaki.
